data.title: Derivative Works Guidelines
data.meta_description: The official website of hololive production, a VTuber agency that consists of the talent groups hololive and HOLOSTARS. This page features our Derivative Works Guidelines.
data.text:
Introduction

COVER Corp. (hereinafter to be referred to as “We”, “Us”, or “Our” as the case may be) has established these Guidelines for Use of Music (hereinafter to be referred to as “music guidelines” or “these guidelines”) in regards to the use of music content provided by us (hereinafter to be referred to as “Our music”), so that fans will have peace of mind when making use of our music.

For works making use of our music, please refer to both the music guidelines and overall guidelines.

Applicable Music

These guidelines pertain to any original song by hololive production-affiliated talents that is distributed on various music distribution platforms (hereinafter to be referred to as “Applicable music”).

The use of music listed in the provided appendix does not fall within the scope of these guidelines.

Musical Derivative Works

We allow covers, adaptations, and remixes of applicable music (hereinafter to be referred to as “covers” for covers, or “musical derivative works” for adaptations and remixes).

* We consider derivative works to be creations born of fans’ ideas and creativity, based on our music. Therefore, we do not consider the reproduction of our music as is, or with modifications lacking creative input, to be classified as derivative works. Such use does not fall within the scope of the music or overall guidelines.

We allow our music to be performed by DJs, regardless of the above-mentioned rule. However, please be aware that if you are streaming via YouTube, or another video sharing platform, we may be alerted via the Content ID system.

Furthermore, we do not allow extraction of our talents’ voices from our songs to be used in speech generation, and do not consider this to be derivative work.

Use of Applicable Music

We allow submission of musical derivative works to YouTube, Niconico, and other video sharing sites, as well as SoundCloud and other music sharing sites (hereinafter to be referred to as “Sharing sites”).

We will not exercise our copyright rights, including related rights, in regards to the creation or submission of musical derivative works as long as they comply with the music guidelines.

We will not interfere with the use of partner programs or creator programs on sharing sites, or any advertising revenue earned thereof.

* We forbid the registration of any created or submitted musical derivative work with Content ID, or any other automated identification system, as your own work.

When submitting musical derivative works, please credit as below.

[Example]

Song: Shiny Smily Story

Artist: hololive IDOL PROJECT

You can download the source files of our music for covers, or for other derivative creation purposes, from our piapro page (URL: https://piapro.jp/hololive ). When using these sound source files, the monetization feature will not be available. You may use the monetization feature when using our registered library of sound source files through YouTube Shorts, TikTok, and other sharing websites.

If performing as a DJ and/or submitting to a sharing site, please ensure that you have paid the appropriate copyright fees. Should any processing be required, we ask that you process the payment of said copyright royalties appropriately.

These guidelines do not apply to the sales of musical derivative works on CD, vinyl records, or other physical media, or activities other than posting on a sharing website, such as distributing through a music streaming service. For such use, please confirm with the representative publisher individually.

Playlist

Derivative musical works posted on sharing sites and that have been registered through the below link may be included in the playlist of the official hololive YouTube channel.

Please use this link to register

In addition, regarding the inclusion of derivative musical works, songs may be removed from the playlist without notifying the creator at our discretion, due to changes in the theme or other such changes.

Use in Official Content

Derivative musical works posted on sharing sites and that have been registered through the below link may be used in official programs, broadcasts, and other content produced by us through our hololive production channels.

In such instances, we will contact the creator of the derivative musical work.

Lastly, we may, at our discretion, remove the derivative musical work if it is later found to have violated the guidelines, application requirements, and/or other factors.

Please use this link to register

Our Requests

In addition to “our requests” in the overall guidelines, please also comply with the following requests when creating musical derivative works.

Please be mindful of our talents, and refrain from creating derivative works that they may find unpleasant.

Please limit your creation of derivative works to a fan or hobby level. Do not use your created content for business purposes, or for purposes that can be deemed as for-profit.

Furthermore, even if you belong to a corporation, you are welcome to create derivative works of our music, including covers (sometimes referred to as “utatte mita”), provided you comply with these guidelines.

Please comply with all applicable laws and regulations, including the terms and rules of any relevant platforms.

Please refrain from creating derivative works that fall under the following categories:

Content that is falsely represented as official, or can be misinterpreted or mistaken as official

Content that is contradictory to public order and morality, or exceeds what is socially acceptable

Content that includes matters pertaining to any particular ideology, belief, religion, or politics

Content that damages our image, or that of our talents or our content

Content that damages a third party’s image, or violates their rights

Other content that we deem unsuitable
